metadata.title: CVE-2015-8390 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
PCRE before 8.38 mishandles the [: and \\ substrings in character classes,which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (uninitializedmemory read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a craftedregular expression, as demonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp objectencountered by Konqueror.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2').
